title: In what way did al-Ghazali combine Sufism with orthodox Islam? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is nothing like—Orthodox Islam. Islam is what it has been ever since. It is the whimsical thinking of some self-assumed modernists, liberals, and secularists which keep switching its name and character. When Ghazali could not reconcile the Philosophical dispensations with those of the Divine, (Obviously there is no comparison between the two; one is the product of mundaneness, while the other of Divine wisdom) he, turned to Sufism. Sufism is essentially a way within the strictures of Islam with extensive exaltation and contemplation to connect with the Divine in a peculiar way—-beyond the reaches of a commoner. shakir2.wordpress.com
*The Wahabies name the followers of Islam as Sufis. And name themselves as followers of Islam, where they follow Yazidism (Sect of Hinduism)* http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yazidis
